title: Topman font? anybody please
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130528221235im_/http:/typophile.com/files/topman_logo_4038.jpg)

Can anyone tell what typeface is used for the topman logo? I thought Gotham, but I'm not sure.

Thanks in advance Rob!!
author: robbiefa

comments.content: The "P"'s not right, but it's d\*mn close to Gotham.
It's dang close to Gotham, the T and the P look a little more extended though, Sorry I'm stumped too.

[Sackers Heavy Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20130528221235/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/sackers_heavy_gothic/?sample_text=topman&sample_size=60) also similar, but too wide.
I thought this was going to be fairly easy... maybe this is just custom!

Fun(ny) fact found on that site:

1945. Burton produces the demob suit for war veterans, nicknamed ‘The Full Monty' it incorporates a suit, shirt and tie. At this time Burton was estimated to be clothing around one-fifth of the British male population.
